revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Marco Papavero|Marco Papavero]] ([[User talk:Marco Papavero|talk]]) to last revision by [[User:imported>M86|imported>M86]]
revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Linksys |model=LAPAC1200 |revision= |upc=745883635443 |asin=B00KB49P1A;US; |fcc_date=04/30/2014 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=SerComm |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=now |type=access point |fcc_id=Q87-LAPAC1200 |ic_id=3839A-LAPAC1200 |pcb_id=AUF00D-1.6 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_poe=at |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |cpu1_model=QCA9557;QCA9557-AT4A; |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12835FMI |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM68B16CWQH-25H |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=looks like it |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=QCA9557;QCA9557-AT4A; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=QCA9882 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Atheros |eth_chip2_model=AR8035 |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks (SiGe);SE2565T;;2; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks (SiGe);SE5003L1;;2; |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os=Linux |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.252 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|AC1200 Dual Band Business Access Point}} :[https://www.linksys.com/us/p/P-lapac1200/ Product page] {{SupportPage|vendor=Linksys|model=LAPAC1200|pid=01t80000003L4NzAAK}}
"AUF00D-1.6" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :The same text is on the [[Linksys LAPAC1750|LAPAC1750]]'s board in its' FCC photos.
QCA9882 is presumed to be used for the 5 GHz radio, but, as the FCC photos :are not terribly illuminating, the exact P/N is unknown.
Default settings are per '''Linksys''''s manual. {{see also|Linksys LAPAC1750|SerComm}} {{WiFiCert|WFA54919|06/04/2014}} :notes OS used as Linux, seems to indicate use of a v2 QCA988x radio
===Reviews=== *[https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/33159-2x2-ac-access-point-roundup?showall=&start=3 ''Linksys LAPAC1200'' on '''SmallNetBuilder''']
